msContents.summary: The text of the will deals with the 9 different properties. The will bequeathes these various properties upon the Hor's eldest son Abaa.

msItemStruct.note: contains an abstract of the document as well as the text itself
The document is made up of six sheets and has five joins of about 1.5cm each.
Year 6, Mechir, of Pharaoh Ptolemy, son of Ptolemy and Kleopatra
Related to P.Hearst06. Hearst07 is the land settlement bequeathed to the children of the marriage contracted in Hearst06.
Bancroft Library, Univ. of Calif., Berkeley

condition.ab: good quality papyrus; light brown color;

handDesc.p: The text is written very fluidly and must have been written by an experienced hand. There is even spacing between lines and it is very legible. The abstract appears to be slightly more cursive and the text a little more faded than the body of the document. Some paleographical peculiarities of the hand which wrote this document are among the following: two diagonal strokes are used for the house determinative in qd, hbs, and wrh. It commonly writes w and wn with disconnected strokes.
